namespacesFlagDescription: A comma separated list of namespaces to include when retrieveing metadata. By default namespaces are excluded.

merge.commandDescription: Merges one SFDX package file into another.
merge.sourceFlagDescription: The source SFDX package. This package wins all conflict battles!
merge.destinationFlagDescription: The destination SFDX package which contains the merge results. It will be created if it does not exist.

permissions.commandDescription: Retrieve all metadata related to Profile security/access permissions.
permissions.packageFlagDescription: The path to the package file to be generated. By default the path is '%s'
permissions.metadataFlagDescription: A comma separated list of the metadata types to include. This overrides the default list: %s.

build.commandDescription: Builds a standard SFDX source format package file from the specified org's existing metadata.
build.packageFlagDescription: The path to the package file to be generated. By default the path is '%s'
build.optionsFlagDescription: A file containing the package build options. Specifying this option will create the file if it doesn't exist already.
build.metadataFlagDescription: A comma separated list of metadata to include. This list overrides any exclude list in the options file.

dictionary.commandDescription: Generates a DataDictionary-[Org].xlsx file from an Org's Object & Field metadata.
dictionary.reportFlagDescription: The path for the data dictionary report XLSX file. This overrides the default: %s.
dictionary.optionsFlagDescription: A file containing the Data Dictionary options. Specifying this option will create the file if it doesn't exist already.

permissions.commandDescription:
Generate a security report based on configured permissions.
The accuracy of this report is dependant on the configuration in the local project.
It is suggested that a permissions package be created using the acumen:package:permissions
command and that package is retrieved from the org prior to executing this command.
permissions.sourceFlagDescription: The source folder to start the meta scan from. The default is '%s'.
permissions.metadataFoldersFlagDescription: A comma separated list of folders to include. This list overrides the defaults: %s.
permissions.reportFlagDescription: The path for the permissions report XLSX file. This overrides the default: %s.

delta.sourceFlagDescription: The source folder to start the delta scan from.
delta.destinationFlagDescription: The destination folder for the deltas.
delta.forceFlagDescription: Path to a file containing folders & files to include in the delta destination. Will override md5/git AND ignore file contents.
delta.ignoreFlagDescription: Path to a file containing folders & files to ignore. Will override md5/git file contents.
delta.deleteReportFlagDescription: Path to a file to write deleted files.
delta.checkFlagDescription: Does a dry-run of a deployment. Inspect the log file for results. NOTE: This option is ignored if no (d)estination option is provided.

git.commandDescription: Uses a git-diff file to detect deltas. Generate a git-diff.txt diff file as follows: git --no-pager diff --name-status --no-renames -w <target branch> > git-diff.txt
git.gitFlagDescription: The output of a git-diff command (https://git-scm.com/docs/git-diff)

md5.commandDescription: Uses an MD5 hash file to detect deltas.
md5.md5FlagDescription: The MD5 hash list file to use

xpath.commandDescription: Validates XML against xpath selects and known bad values.
xpath.optionsFlagDescription: A file containing the XPathOptions json. Specifying this option will create the file if it doesn't exist already.

clear.commandDescription: Clears the Apex Code Coverage data from the specified Org.
clear.metadataFlagDescription: An optional comma separated list of metadata to include. The defaults are: (%s.)

execute.commandDescription: Executes Apex tests and includes Code Coverage metrics.
execute.waitDescription: The optional wait time (minutes) for test execution to complete. A value of -1 means infinite wait. This flag is ignored if Apex Test execution is skipped.
